001package ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.persistence.segment;
002
003import ca.gc.cra.radar.domain.capture.SegmentRecord;
004import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
005import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
006import java.io.Closeable;
007import java.io.DataInputStream;
008import java.io.DataOutputStream;
009import java.io.EOFException;
010import java.io.FilterOutputStream;
011import java.io.Flushable;
012import java.io.IOException;
013import java.io.OutputStream;
014import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
015import java.nio.file.Files;
016import java.nio.file.Path;
017import java.time.Instant;
018import java.time.ZoneId;
019import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.Comparator;
022import java.util.List;
023import java.util.stream.Collectors;
024import java.util.stream.Stream;
025
026/**
027 * Minimal segment file format compatible with legacy segbin (SGB1) files.
028 * <p>Provides sequential append and iteration utilities; not thread-safe.</p>
029 *
030 * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
031 */
032public final class SegmentBinIO {
033  private static final byte[] MAGIC = {'S', 'G', 'B', '1'};
034  private static final int HEADER_LEN = 4;
035
036  private SegmentBinIO() {}
037
038  /**
039   * Writer for SGB1 segment files with optional rolling support.
040   *
041   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
042   */
043  public static final class Writer implements Closeable, Flushable {
044    private static final DateTimeFormatter TS =
045        DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("uuuuMMdd-HHmmss").withZone(ZoneId.systemDefault());
046
047    private final Path directory;
048    private final String baseName;
049    private final long rollBytes;
050
051    private CountingOutputStream countingOut;
052    private DataOutputStream dataOut;
053    private int partIndex = 0;
054
055    /**
056     * Creates a writer that emits files into {@code directory} and rolls after {@code rollMiB}.
057     *
058     * @param directory target directory; created if absent
059     * @param baseName base file name without extension
060     * @param rollMiB roll size in mebibytes; {@code <=0} disables rolling
061     * @throws IOException if the directory cannot be prepared or the first file cannot be opened
062     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
063     */
064    public Writer(Path directory, String baseName, int rollMiB) throws IOException {
065      this.directory = directory;
066      this.baseName = baseName;
067      this.rollBytes = rollMiB <= 0 ? Long.MAX_VALUE : rollMiB * 1024L * 1024L;
068      Files.createDirectories(directory);
069      openNewFile();
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Appends a segment record to the current file.
074     *
075     * @param record segment record to serialize; {@code null} is ignored
076     * @throws IOException if writing fails
077     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
078     */
079    public void append(SegmentRecord record) throws IOException {
080      if (record == null) {
081        return;
082      }
083      byte[] payload = record.payload();
084      int payloadLen = payload != null ? payload.length : 0;
085      byte[] srcBytes = record.srcIp().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
086      byte[] dstBytes = record.dstIp().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
087      int recordLen = 8 + 2 + srcBytes.length + 4 + 2 + dstBytes.length + 4 + 8 + 4 + 4 + payloadLen;
088
089      if (rollBytes != Long.MAX_VALUE && countingOut.getCount() + 4L + recordLen > rollBytes) {
090        openNewFile();
091      }
092
093      dataOut.writeInt(recordLen);
094      dataOut.writeLong(record.timestampMicros());
095      dataOut.writeUTF(record.srcIp());
096      dataOut.writeInt(record.srcPort());
097      dataOut.writeUTF(record.dstIp());
098      dataOut.writeInt(record.dstPort());
099      dataOut.writeLong(record.sequence());
100      dataOut.writeInt(record.flags());
101      dataOut.writeInt(payloadLen);
102      if (payloadLen > 0) {
103        dataOut.write(payload, 0, payloadLen);
104      }
105    }
106
107    private void openNewFile() throws IOException {
108      close();
109      String timestamp = TS.format(Instant.now());
110      String fileName = String.format("%s-%s-%04d.segbin", baseName, timestamp, partIndex++);
111      Path path = directory.resolve(fileName);
112      countingOut = new CountingOutputStream(new BufferedOutputStream(Files.newOutputStream(path), 1 << 20));
113      dataOut = new DataOutputStream(countingOut);
114      dataOut.write(MAGIC);
115      dataOut.flush();
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * Flushes buffered bytes to disk.
120     *
121     * @throws IOException if flushing fails
122     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
123     */
124    @Override
125    public void flush() throws IOException {
126      if (dataOut != null) {
127        dataOut.flush();
128      }
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Closes the current file, flushing pending data first.
133     *
134     * @throws IOException if closing fails
135     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
136     */
137    @Override
138    public void close() throws IOException {
139      if (dataOut != null) {
140        try {
141          dataOut.flush();
142        } finally {
143          dataOut.close();
144          dataOut = null;
145          countingOut = null;
146        }
147      }
148    }
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Reader for SGB1 segment files ordered lexicographically by file name.
153   *
154   * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
155   */
156  public static final class Reader implements Closeable {
157    private final List<Path> files;
158    private int index = 0;
159    private DataInputStream in;
160
161    /**
162     * Creates a reader scanning all {@code *.segbin} files in a directory.
163     *
164     * @param directory directory containing segment binaries
165     * @throws IOException if the directory is invalid or files cannot be opened
166     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
167     */
168    public Reader(Path directory) throws IOException {
169      if (!Files.isDirectory(directory)) {
170        throw new IOException("Not a directory: " + directory);
171      }
172      try (Stream<Path> stream = Files.list(directory)) {
173        files = stream
174            .filter(p -> p.getFileName().toString().endsWith(".segbin"))
175            .sorted(Comparator.comparing(p -> p.getFileName().toString()))
176            .collect(Collectors.toList());
177      }
178      openNext();
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Returns the next {@link SegmentRecord} or {@code null} when all files have been consumed.
183     *
184     * @return next segment record or {@code null} at EOF
185     * @throws IOException if reading or file switching fails
186     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
187     */
188    public SegmentRecord next() throws IOException {
189      while (true) {
190        if (in == null) {
191          return null;
192        }
193        try {
194          int recordLen = in.readInt();
195          long ts = in.readLong();
196          String src = in.readUTF();
197          int sport = in.readInt();
198          String dst = in.readUTF();
199          int dport = in.readInt();
200          long seq = in.readLong();
201          int flags = in.readInt();
202          int payloadLen = in.readInt();
203          byte[] payload = new byte[Math.max(0, payloadLen)];
204          if (payloadLen > 0) {
205            in.readFully(payload, 0, payloadLen);
206          }
207          return new SegmentRecord(ts, src, sport, dst, dport, seq, flags, payload);
208        } catch (EOFException eof) {
209          openNext();
210        }
211      }
212    }
213
214    private void openNext() throws IOException {
215      closeStream();
216      if (index >= files.size()) {
217        return;
218      }
219      Path next = files.get(index++);
220      in = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream(Files.newInputStream(next), 1 << 20));
221      byte[] header = new byte[HEADER_LEN];
222      int read = in.read(header);
223      if (read != HEADER_LEN || !Arrays.equals(header, MAGIC)) {
224        throw new IOException("Invalid segment header: " + next);
225      }
226    }
227
228    private void closeStream() throws IOException {
229      if (in != null) {
230        in.close();
231        in = null;
232      }
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * Closes the active input stream.
237     *
238     * @throws IOException if closing fails
239     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
240     */
241    @Override
242    public void close() throws IOException {
243      closeStream();
244    }
245  }
246
247  private static final class CountingOutputStream extends FilterOutputStream {
248    private long count;
249
250    CountingOutputStream(OutputStream out) {
251      super(out);
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Returns the number of bytes written through this stream.
256     *
257     * @return cumulative byte count
258     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
259     */
260    long getCount() {
261      return count;
262    }
263
264    /**
265     * Writes a single byte while tracking the byte count.
266     *
267     * @param b byte to write
268     * @throws IOException if the underlying stream fails
269     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
270     */
271    @Override
272    public void write(int b) throws IOException {
273      out.write(b);
274      count++;
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Writes a byte array region while tracking the byte count.
279     *
280     * @param b source buffer
281     * @param off offset within {@code b}
282     * @param len number of bytes to write
283     * @throws IOException if the underlying stream fails
284     * @since RADAR 0.1-doc
285     */
286    @Override
287    public void write(byte[] b, int off, int len) throws IOException {
288      out.write(b, off, len);
289      count += len;
290    }
291  }
292}
